meanings.definition: Engaging in the study or discussion of religious beliefs and doctrines.
meanings.sent1: The theologizing students had a deep conversation about their faith.
meanings.sent2: She found the theologizing book fascinating and informative.
meanings.sent3: The theologizing group had a heated debate about the meaning of a religious text.
meanings.sent4: His theologizing mind was always seeking answers to spiritual questions.
meanings.sent5: The theologizing class was full of curious individuals eager to learn about different religions.

meanings.definition: The act of interpreting or explaining religious texts or teachings.
meanings.sent1: The theologizing of ancient scriptures requires careful analysis.
meanings.sent2: Her theologizing of the Bible helped her understand its deeper meanings.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's hilarious theologizing of a religious story had the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent4: His theologizing of the Quran shed light on its profound messages.
meanings.sent5: The theologizing of the sacred text revealed hidden truths to the scholars.

meanings.definition: To engage in theological reasoning or reflection.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys theologizing about the nature of God and existence.
meanings.sent2: They spent hours theologizing on the purpose of life.
meanings.sent3: The cat theologized about the meaning of the universe while staring out the window.
meanings.sent4: His mind was constantly theologizing, seeking to understand the mysteries of faith.
meanings.sent5: The philosopher theologized deeply, pondering the complexities of belief systems.
